title: Reported 3-4 times because i banned Jhin when a teammate wanted to play him.
body: At least 2 people teamed up with my ADC and said I was a dick for not letting him play Jhin in a ranked game. All saying they were going to report me. This can't be allowed. Get rid of week 1 new champions in ranked ffs.

Precisely. I was in champ select for a normal, as support, and put {{champion:9}} as my pick intent. My ADC proceeded to ban him, saying he didn't want to play with a Fiddle support. Everyone else started giving me grief about the choice too, saying they wouldn't want a Fiddle support either, and that I should stop being "a little bitch" about my ADC banning the champion I intended to play. I'll probably ask you to reconsider, and will probably dodge if you don't... but I'm not gonna troll you by banning him.

Ranked, however, is a completely different story. If someone bans a just released champion, I wholeheartedly understand. Likewise, if you're looking to try something else that off the wall in ranked, I can understand banning it as well. I'm not saying you ban stuff like Teemo ADC when someone has it as their pick intent, but AD Teemo jungle? I wouldn't report you for banning Teemo then.

Thats the thing about new champs. First two weeks or so, they're just a walking ban slot. Thats why Riot needs to keep new champs from being selectable in Ranked. Every smart person would ban that new champ, wasting it instead of banning someone many people are already familiar with.

Comparing a first time on a newly released champion to first time on a champion that has been released before is apples and oranges.

1. The player is far more likely to have played with or against the older champion. They've seen what items they buy, what their combo generally looks like, etc. New champions provide none of that.
2. Tested and tried build and guides exist for older champions. You've got none of that for a new champion.
3. Your teammates know how to work around an older champion. They're making stabs in the dark on a new one.

You're gambling that the new champion is OP enough to compensate for those shortcomings if you want to take them in Ranked. And if they are OP enough to compensate, are you really surprised they're banned?

I think in general, new champions are banned in Ranked to ensure *neither* side plays them, not to specifically spite your own teammates. 

If we assume everyone playing a Ranked game is doing so with the intent to do their best to win, then we have to conclude that those wanting to play new champions in Ranked must assume them to be OP enough to offset their lack of experience on the Champion. Pick intent here basically says "the new champion is OP." If that player wanting to play the new champion is not first pick, then their intent implies that you *should* ban the new champion. Failing to do ban the new champion is then irresponsible, as you're letting the enemy have a champion your own teammates believe is OP and cannot secure for themselves.
